page.title: 18EGLOSKERRY VILLAGE. (3)
page.content: The road opposite the{church}leads to the rest of the village.On the corner there is the{bus shelter}inside a railed grass enclosure. Then there are private houses to the left and right before you reach the{Village Hall}on the right.This is used for many community functions. Further on to the left there is a small{estate}of about half-a-dozen new houses, with room for more to be built.In fact there is building going on now.Carrying on down the road, on the right are a terrace of{council houses,}a few more private houses, and at the bottom of the hill the road crosses the old railway line. The{station}has been converted into a dwelling house.Before the bridge over the{Kensey}there is a right fork towards{Tregeare.}Over the bridge the road forks again, left to{Launceston, right to{Pipers Pool.
